We are also given that "Mark bought the blue shirt" which is Q.

To determine if we can logically conclude "Lisa bought the red shirt" (P), we need to examine the implications of the given statements. The conditional statement "P → Q" implies that if P is true, then Q must also be true. However, it does not guarantee that P is true if Q is true. In other words, the truth of Q does not necessarily imply the truth of P.
